p: Nucleoside/nucleotide analogues inhibit virus replication by blocking the activity of the polymerase enzyme in the virus (Chhikara et al., 2020; Menéndez-Arias et al., 2014). The usage of nucleoside/nucleotide analogues is a major step in the treatment of patients infected with CoVs due to the appropriate antiviral response (Chhikara et al., 2020). However, the application of these drugs may lead to genetic variation and subsequent mutation emergence. Hence, the safety of RDV and its broad-spectrum anti-viral activity should be considered before suggesting them as potential alternative candidates for clinical development.
